editorialSummary.text: All-you-can-eat Chinese buffet with vast food choices & its namesake dessert in an ornate space.

text.text:
We came here around noon on a Wednesday for the lunch buffet, and there was plenty of seating available, but it got really busy shortly after.

All drinks other than water are an extra charge.

The food was fairly decent. The Peking duck was the one we most enjoyed. You need to line up and get the item from the station handed to you by the staff, but they're pretty quick and will give you two portions or two pieces of duck on one wrap if you ask for it. The skin was crispy!

Lots of other items to choose from for lunch, including sushi rolls, western style breakfast (eggs, bacon, etc), lots of Chinese food (meats and veggies), dim sum, salads, fruit, lots of desserts and ice cream (I enjoyed the green tea flavour mousse cake and ice cream).

I would be interested in coming back to try their dinner menu at some point.

Service was good and they're quick to clear your plates. Paying with cash will give you an 8% discount.

This was a bit of a surprise. When Dragon Pearl first opened years ago, there was nothing like it. The atmosphere, the food, value for money was all top notch. In comparison the other all you can eat Chinese restaurant chain seemed stale and dated. You can tell the owner put a lot of thought and money into this place and building its reputation. Things have sadly changed.
One example is they used to have a soup station with a chef cutting freshly made noodles into this large cauldron. That beef soup was amazing! Over the years that chef became a quirky robot, hacking away at the noodles with a large chef knife. This was fun for to watch and the soup was still delicious. This time I went to that same area to get my soup and it just wasn’t there anymore. When I asked, one of the workers said “we don’t have that anymore, it wasn’t popular” That’s sad!
Okay what about the rest of the food? There’s noticeably much less selection than ever!
Okay well, how about the quality? Not near as good as it used to be. The Duck was dry and almost tasteless. The oyster was okay, I guess that’s why there was a lineup for them. The rest of the food I had was mediocre to just okay at best.
My whole party felt this way including a friend from mainland China who ended up just not eating much at all. (We hyped the buffet and she was genuinely excited to try it out)
This is so sad!
I sincerely hope Dragon Perl becomes less complacent, adds more variety, and most importantly improves the quality of their food. Good restaurants need to be consistent and speaking of that older chain I mentioned in the beginning, that one is consistently good. The atmosphere isn’t nearly as nice as Dragon Pearl though. So sad!!

I recommend making reservations, especially during the weekend as it is very busy.  Friday's and Sunday's they feature all you can eat crab. There is a 90min time limit while seated.  Buffet style Chinese food and all was great, and did not disappoint.  I would definitely return.  The service was rated 4 stars as I think they were understaffed, and very slow to refill our water and take our dishes away.

They are currently offering all you can eat oysters on weekdays (Monday-Thursday) dinner for $47 per person until mid June. They have 3 different types of oyster, raw, grilled garlic and mayo cheese. They have a good selection from the basics like fried rice to sashimi to charcuterie to peeking duck and more. The quality of the food was pretty good.
However, the lines for oysters and peeking duck were extremely long. Their seating area is quite big but the area where you grab food is on the smaller side. So it was very packed. We went on a Thursday night and they actually ended up running out of oysters. Which was disappointing, they did end up giving some people including us a discount but it wasn’t given to everyone. We just got lucky as my friend went to the oyster station just as they ran out.

This is a great buffet if you’re looking for some premium items you wouldn’t find normally at Mandarin.

Went on a weekday but I believe they have crab legs on the weekend. Highlights are Peking duck, raw oysters and sashimi, baked oysters that came in huge shells, jumbo prawns, bbq selection and stir fried crab. Dessert section is also pretty nice and has some Asian desserts like green tea/mango mousse cake, mango jelly and hot mango & taro sago. My girlfriend also said the mashed potatoes were surprisingly good and were made from real potatoes lol

editorialSummary.text: Full-range supermarket emphasizing Middle Eastern items, plus prepared foods, pastry & baked goods.

text.text:
Big grocery store that has a great variety of fruits and vegetables. They also have an extensive variety of cooked and uncooked meat items.

I loved the variety of cakes and pastries at this store. They looked amazing!

Nice large selection of imported Mediterranean food. They usually have those hard to find items. Baked goods look great. Know your grocery prices before you shop here. I can't speak about meat counter because I only trust my butcher. Love the adventure of perusing this store.

Please don’t trust them with the sale price in fact they charge you more, how should someone trust them that their meat is halal, I went on 18th March, the announce the price on 14 march how much people they have ripped off? Just do the calculations

Shopping at Adonis last night looking for my favorite cheeses for Christmas. Found 2 kinds of stilton and whiskey cheedar cheese, they have such a nice assortment here. I also purchased olives stuffed with garlic, there olive bar is so fresh. Got a cooked chicken, hummos, garlic sauce and the freshest
pita bread.
Only bad thing to note was the clementine with leaf they looked  so dry and shriveled the normal quality was not the normal and they were expensive...disappointed. you need to remove them and get fresh

Update
Ordered beef samosas, pita bread, hummus and made a delicious salad from there produce. So delicious.  There pitas are so fresh its a joy to shop here! The chick pea salad and couscous  salad are the best! Love to eat them with the samosas

A good quality Middle Eastern full range grocery store that has some unique offerings.

Of course, it has the typical produce, meat, seafood, bakery and pantry items. They also have specialty nuts, cheese, hot foods and in house made pitas that are not found elsewhere.

Some items are priced in line with other mainstream grocery stores. While some items are more expensive than other grocers.

Great Mediterranean food! Yes, it's worth the hype. Had some good quality shawarma after a long time. Quantity is good. Service was also good. Price is reasonable.

Tip: if you are really hungry, find another place cos you have to wait a little bit to get your food here as it's crowded almost all the time( which is definitely a good sign for quality food).

Could've improved the seating and the air conditioning a little bit. Had a tough time with the heat inside the store as I was dining.

Overall, Sumac is a must try!! Will definitely visit again.

The best shawarma by far I’ve had! Honestly I love the salad n dressing it comes with their hummus and garlic sauce is perfect and their potatoes are unique. Their shawarma meat is fresh but wish they put more. Their wraps are so juicy and delicious 🤤

Definitely try it out!

Great tasting food! A bit small to sit down. Perfect for takeout. I've also had the Mix Grill Family meal. The kebabs come with 1 tanoor bread and grilled onion and tomato. Make it a combo to get rice, salad, more bread, hummus and garlic sauce.

Shawarma is legit, would order take out again. Tasted both veal and chicken classic LB style on freshly made bread. We enjoyed the Tannour bread. Not ideal to grab a table, sit down, and enjoy a meal. My all-star benchmark is Ghadir and now both are good spots for shawarma.

The kebabs are 10/10. It was really rich, fatty and tender. I think they combine the lamb fat with beef, but you can tell there is lamb in there. Definitely a must when you go to this restaurant. It is a bit of a wait time since they are cooking the kebabs fresh but worth it. I would definitely order the kebab wrap &/ plate again.

editorialSummary.text: Down-to-earth local chain known for South Indian specialties, including 30 kinds of biryanis.

text.text: Great place for a brunch or family lunch. Even though it's spacious. It does get crowded and noisy. And it may take time to get your food to the table. It makes up with delicious biryani and other Indian food. Staff are friendly and helpful. Reservations recommended during peak lunch and dinner hours.

The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere, and overall it feels like a very authentic Indian experience. The food was delicious, both Tandoori Chicken and Malai Tikka Kebab were so flavourful and tender ( the Tandoori Chicken probably still neeeded a bit of cooking time, but still delicious), same goes for the Paneer Biryani.

On the other hand, service needs to be a bit improved. For sure the servers were pretty busy, so I don't blame them, but, during our meal,we dropped a spoon, and asked for another one, but we never received it, shortly after we finished the water, asked for more and we ve been waiting 10+ minutes before we got a new bottle.

We had an issue with one of our dishes that somehow had an unwanted object that probably fell in during the cooking ( i  in a restaurant, so i know this kind of things can happen) in it. But the server was very kind and promptly replaced it.

Overall positive, but a bit of extra care fixing these issues would be great.

Such a bad experience i had in my whole life while eating on this restaurant I went there with my 3 friends we ordered butter paneer masala which was sweet as its having 1 kg of sugar in a bowl of it. However, we ate mutton masala which was much better than the rest of  food. After this we ordered one masala dosa just to give one more chance to them in which they were still not good and the problem was its  not having any spice just the boiled potatoes and then we talked to the supervisor on shift he was not apologising instead of that he was explaining us how the masala dosa tastes like as we all are from india and also from 4 of us 3 of us are working as a line cook in the fine dine restaurants. If someone is reading my review I am not going to suggest this restaurant to anyone. Also I attached the photos

Mutton biryani was so good.
I ordered double ka metha thinking it would be authentic as we get in Hyderabad, but it was flop. Just 4 pieces of fried normal bread with dry fruits. It was not even sweet. Desserts not recommended.

This is probably the best Hyderabadi biryani I've had in GTA yet. The flavours here felt spot on.

We came in on a busy night but still were accommodated swiftly. The servers were nice and upon ordering were surprised that the complete order arrived within minutes. Really enjoyed the biryani but dosa and chicken 65 which we had were really good too. My wife recently came here again and enjoyed the food too.

Will certainly be back to try more.

editorialSummary.text: Venerable, no-frills venue in a strip mall offering Middle Eastern roasted meats & other basics.

text.text: We ordered the Mixed Shawarma, and it was a perfect 10/10 – incredibly flavorful, well-filled, and well-presented. The customer service was exceptionally good, with friendly and attentive staff who went above and beyond to ensure we had a great dining experience. Highly recommend!

Had a good experience with the food. The people making it looks efficient. The ambiance of the place and set-up is a little confusing for me. The menu is with the grilling and food section and you’d have to remember your order and line up at the grocery cashier behind and there wasn’t clear line. Then we’d have to cross the bread making section to get to the dining area. We ordered falafel and mix rice plate and both servings and flavors are good. They do large or party orders and would love to try that.

Super authentic! My mother and I loved the vibe in there, it was insanely busy on a Sunday, we grabbed a shawarma platter to go and some sides, everything was amazing! So fresh, and no wonder, there were so many people in there working and shopping, it was efficient though. A bit of a wait, but understandably so; there were like 50 people in there, and at least one of the orders looked to be for a massive event somewhere. Go here only if you have time and patience.

The portion is enormous for a reasonable price; my mother and I both ate until we were way too full. Just one platter shared!
We additionally bought a bag of pitas while we were there, because why not!?

Solid spot for kebabs/shawarma. My family of 4 got the Ghadir Special, Large Rice, Large Coleslaw, and Large Fattouch. It was a good amount for all of us. The special came with 3x naan, but there was also a bonus one under the meats. I'll return to try their shawarma wrap.

We went there for the 2nd time cause we loved the shawarma there but this time the sandwiches were dry.  It is still good but you feel all the spices that they are adding are overpowering the taste of the meat or chicken.  As of I am eating a sandwich os spices.   Let us say it is good but not yet the best shawarma sandwich.

The seating area is good but kind of cheap.  We wanted to have fish but I was not encouraged with how the restaurant looked   .    I think they need to do a major renovations,  cleaner, better categories etc.
But they have many things that you can order especially Arabic food, deserts etc..  I still advise you to go there but next time u visit, I will tell him exactly when I want in my sandwich.
Note:  the things I also liked is that they are generous with portions and I asked him for extra tahini and garlic and he didn't hesitate, directly prepared them.  Other places start charing you an extra 1 or 2 dollars.

If you are a vegetarian then this restaurant is a must for you. It's super crowded, for good reason of course . Weekends are sometimes 2 hours waiting.. if you can stop your hunger then it's for you...

Weekends are better but still plan it well.

All the items we had were good. Finger licking good...
Ambiance is awesome for a vegetarian restaurant and in that area.

Though it's over crowded that doesn't mean your food will be delivered on the table late.. They are fast....

Overall a good place to dine in with friends and family.

The name "Ishq" says it all. Lovely ambience where you can go with family, friends or your love.
The food was too good, just the starter Tomato soup was not same as we had earlier, however other all the things were very good.
I don't know if we were in the rush hour or what but in the start of the dinner the service was kinda low, as example we order three starters we got 2 and 3rd one came very late, after that we asked for extra empty bowl which took around 10 mins. approx. But suddenly during our main course all the service were very accurate and fast enough for everything.
Over-all, I will still prefer to come back here because of the Vibe and Food. 😋😁

Very nice ambience.. the decor and the vibe both were top notch.. the food was amazing. Our server rishab was great and helpful and made sure we ordered right.. overall a very good experience. There is a wait time to get a table. So be ready for that.

I visited this restaurant with my friends. Must say, the food is amazing! Fast serving, friendly staff, everything was just Perfect and adding elegance to our personal quality time with my friends. Particularly, I'd like to recognize Rushabh who helped us in selecting best dishes. Highly recommended!

Everything was excellent about this place. First time trying out this place and I must say that I was impressed. I went there on a Saturday around 12.30 pm and it was starting to get busy. The waitress was excellent. She even went on to explain how the different types of briyani were made. She also checked frequently if we needed any help etc. Will definitely be back to this place and I highly recommend checking it out .

I love Mexican food, specially Tacos and I love margaritas. And Anejo offers both in a high quality and a nice atmosphere.

We reserved a table on the patio (covered during winter) and were seated at no time upon arrival. The staff are very friendly.

The service is great and we received information on specials and recommendations for our order.

We ordered “Guacamole”, and tacos. Guacamole is fresh and made at your table; it’s always nice to watch food preparation.

The food was fresh and tasty and we enjoyed the both the vibe and our food.

The tacos was absolutely immaculate specially the shrimp and fish and the Quesabirria (chefs kiss). Table guacamole was good and they mix the ingredients in front of us (presentation was sweet).

we had the classic margarita pitcher and it was 10/10 - enough for 6 people.

Christina was our server and he was genuinely amazing. Constantly checking in on us, all requests were accepted and brought to us quickly such as salt, Lemon, group pictures and videos taking our shots- he was supper sweet and cheering us on for my graduation).

Really really recommend this branch and recommend having Christian as your waiter (he also checks in with food allergies and takes them seriously unlike other restaurants I’ve been to!!

Me and my friends had a wonderful experience the food was amazing big portions and can be shared. The service was amazing as well he explained everything how they make and if we didn’t know what it is he told us. The washroom very nice and clean as well

Food not great at all. Tacos tasted completely different than the King St location (they were much better there, and used different fish?). The chicken and pork tacos were completely dry (probably from the warmer they keep them in). Salsa is extra, have never seen this before at any Mexican restaurant. Hot sauce caddy was placed on the table with regular hot sauces you can buy at any grocery store. Save this and provide salsa with the tacos. Drinks were good, and guacamole made table side was a nice touch. Service was below average, 10 min for anyone to touch the table, not attentive at all, often had to look for the server when we needed something.

I love Mexican food.
Anejo has a downtown location but this one is close to my grandparents house.

Ambiance:
Cool vibe, great for drinks, appetizers and dinner. Very chill.

Service:
It was great, server was attentive and helpful.

Food:
Love their tacos! We got the pork carnitas, beef and fish tacos!

Highly recommend this restaurant!!

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed, contemporary dining spot with a broad menu featuring international & regional dishes.

text.text:
Friendly staff, good food, with a nice bar to watch your favorite sports.
It's a popular, loud, and busy restaurant bar, so expect longer waits. Reservations are highly recommended, especially on Friday nights and the weekends. Staff try their best to accommodate walk ins, sometimes they offer free drinks while you wait.
Lia and another lady (which unfortunately I did not get her name) were extremely helpful and considerate to arrange a booth quickly, as I had some guests who could not sit at a high table.
Parking is limited, so you might need to walk a bit.
Pictures are from different visits.

Three of us really enjoyed our visit to Joey's.
Interior and ambience was very nice. We sat down upstairs on the patio, amazing weather and we enjoyed the view. Service was exceptional,  we were served by few different waiters, all did wonderfully. Food was good, tasty and good portions for the money. One thing that was a bit off, was the meat was just little too cold, still edible. See the photos. We paid ~ $190 +tip for three mains, beer, sangria, coke. Pricy.

My girlfriend and I went to the VIP theatre in the plaza and had reservations at Joey’s after the show. Had a great dinner and great waitress, Donnie. She was very attentive and so sweet. When we ordered a dessert after dinner she asked us if we’re friends and for how long.  This was how she presented our dessert. Other staff were also wonderful. Great evening and we will be back.

The place gave us a warm welcome with champagne, creating a great vibe. It's perfect for quick catch-ups with friends, especially with their all-day happy hour offering any drink for $5. Plus, their tofu bowl was a highlight for me!

Came on a Saturday for a late lunch. Reserved online in case as it can tend to get busy on a Saturday. We were seated right away with a party of 5.

Ambience is nice, the place is big and modern decor. It was busy, but not full. They had the happy hour menu from 2 to 5 pm, which most of us ordered from, good selection of food as well as alcoholic drinks to choose from.

The pics are the steak frites but requested more fries and no veggies, Truffle Parmesan Fries, Tuna Poke bowl, Ahi tuna club sandwich with Fries, and the pressed burger with yam Fries. Everyone liked their food, and decent portions.

The server was nice and came by often to check on us. A good place to hang out with friends, family or for couples. Definitely recommend the happy hour menu, slightly better with pricing.

editorialSummary.text: Extensive buffet in a casual space offering local & Chinese dishes, as well as sushi.

text.text: As the old saying goes, “Variety is the spice of life,” and if this is true then Mandarin Restaurant is the place for you. My wife and I took our family to the Mandarin for dinner. At this all you can eat buffet there were so many different kinds of foods to choose from that it was truly mind boggling. From hot Chinese dishes, Roast Beef, cold salads, and sweet desserts there was plenty to go around. My family filled up our plates multiple times and we all enjoyed ourselves immensely. I highly recommend this terrific restaurant.

Good food, Great place and excellent staff. It's a very busy place.

Lots of food options. Including Asian and western. Went for one of my friends birthday and free for him on his day. Lots of choices but not enough into Chinese taste. (That's why missing one star here) Like most of the other dishes and desserts. Well built place for family gatherings. Easy free parking.

Mandarin is what it is and they deserve a ton of respect for doing it this long...

The staff are amazing and tend to you with regularity, politeness, enthusiasm and professionalism. 5 star Service.

Food, you know what you are getting by going to a Mandarin. You don't come here cause you want captivating Asian food, you come cause you want American Chinese food and other great options your grandparents from back country Ontario will eat.

You will always find food you like, and you will eat as much of it as you can.

The atmosphere is a bit dated, but is classic Mandarin; still nice to go to every now and then with a group of people who don't know what they would order at a Family style restaurant. Looking at you uncle Fred.
The food was dry, everything was sweet. Overall, dry, bland, or extremely sweet. Cheap quality. Not coming back, not worth my money. There are tons of other amazing chinese restaurants in Toronto.

I recently visited Mandarin Restaurant for their free Canada Day buffet, and it was an incredible experience! The restaurant was also celebrating their 45th anniversary, which made the atmosphere even more special. The buffet had a fantastic selection of dishes, each one more delicious than the last. The staff were friendly and attentive, making sure everyone had a great time. The decorations and celebratory touches added a festive feel to the occasion. I highly recommend Mandarin Restaurant for their amazing food, excellent service, and the perfect blend of celebration and culinary delight. Five stars all the way!

Visited Mangal two days in a row. Once for a birthday gathering and the following day with a couple of friends, First time trying Turkish Cuisine must say the atmosphere was fantastic. Food was quick and delicious. They accomodated our own music and singing and to top it off, Melissa our server was simply the best. She was friendly, had an amicable nature, recommended food for us and  took good care of us. Melissa absolutely loves her job and is very knowledgeable about Turkish cuisine. 5 stars  for her. Would definitely visit again.

Had a great experience! The food and staff were great! The staff were really attentive!

This restaurant is huge! We made reservations for Mother’s Day and we were seated right away. Live music was the cherry on top!

They gave roses in the end. What a beautiful touch!

My partner and I had an incredible first-time dining experience here. From the moment we stepped in, the ambiance was inviting and cozy. Our server, Honor, was attentive and recommended some fantastic dishes. Our entire meal was his recommendation! And every bite from the appetizer to the dessert was so delicious! I wish I took more photos. We left feeling thoroughly satisfied, will definitely return, and made me want to message all my friends and family to tell them about the amazing experience. Highly recommend Mangal for anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience! And 100% it would be a bonus if you get Honor as your server because he was so amazing and so knowledgeable.

The food and service are exceptional!! I am really glad I found this gem of a place. The meat was really tender and delicious. The kebab melts in your mouth. And the dessert is so amazing. Kunafes and rice pudding are the best!
Also shoutout to mustafa for being a great server. This man has managerial potential

I discovered this place online by accident while looking for another place. The reviews were incredible so I had to see for myself. Long story short - The reviews were very deserving!! Before I get into it, I will say that I have no idea what the names of the dishes are so bear with me. The inside is actually quite big and nicely laid out. It's really clean and you can see the bar and the kitchen from the seating area, which adds to the ambiance and charm of the restaurant. While we were looking through the menu, we were brought a complementary plate of some type of yogurt sauce, feta cheese and tomato salsa with a pita type bread - which we were not expecting - But apparently that's just what they do! It was delicious. We ordered the chicken kabob and the lamb and beef skewer. Not only did both dishes look magical, but they tasted even better than they looked. The lamb/beef thing was dripping and exploding with flavour. The chicken kabob was chicken breast but somehow it was plump and juicy as well. All of the sides on the dish - The red onions, the cabbage, fresh bread, charred jalapeno and tomatoe and the rice were perfect pairings to the meats. The service here was also really good - friendly and quick. Apparently there is also complimentary tea but I didn't realize this when I declined. I will definitely be back to try more of their menu. This place is expensive but well worth it for special occasions or for when you want to treat yourself!

editorialSummary.text: Unassuming eatery serving up familiar Persian cuisine such as lamb & chicken kebabs.

text.text: Super authentic Persian food. The portion is crazy big which I can easily eat for two meals or more. The tachin with lamb neck is so good. The neck is in a gelatinous state and falls apart with gentle forking. The saffron rice is pan fried (?) with a nice crust. It is floral and compliments the meat well.

Good quality food. Plenty of options in the menu with authentic genuine persian food recepie. We ordered Kabab Soltani, Tahchin and Lamb shank, Ghormeh Sabzi and kashke bademjoon and they were all great and delicious! prices are fair for the portion (portions were huge!) and the staff were really polite, friendly and helpful. Was  kind of busy to dine-in today so might not be a bad idea to do a reservation or call before you visit. Enjoyed our time there today and we’ll definitely go back. Highly recommended.

Despite being located far from the area I live and having several restaurants nearby, what truly sets this Persian restaurant apart is the exceptional quality and taste of their food. We consistently choose to dine here whether eating out or ordering in. The kebabs are juicy and perfectly grilled. Their Koobideh, Barg and chicken leg kebabs stand out as one of the best I've had anywhere.
Additionally, the staff are always nice and friendly.

This one is by far one of the best Persian restaurants in Toronto. It may not be on Yonge street, but for sure it' worth to visit if you are in the city. The foods are from heaven and the sercice is top notch.

I have been living in Canada for around five years, and I can confidently say that I’ve tried nearly every Persian restaurant in Toronto and the GTA. However, this place stands out spectacularly. The food here is absolutely divine, with portions so generous that each dish can easily satisfy two people. Their Khoresht Mast is a revelation, tasting exactly like the ones in Isfahan. I cannot recommend this place enough. The service is exceptional and incredibly friendly. Every visit with my family is a joyous experience. Considering the massive portions, the prices are very reasonable. This place is absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended.

editorialSummary.text: Unadorned Indian counter-serve specializing in dosa, idly & vada, plus milkshakes & lassi.

text.text:
Hello all, Went here on Saturday and food was good and tasty. But the Mysore Bonda taste is same as you eat at scarbrough branch and it was okok. You will eat 1 bonda and feel like I am done with bonda. I understand matching Indian tase here in Canada is very challenging. The only reason I don’t like is too much oil in Mysore bonda. After tax the breakfast buffet cost you around 26$.
Best thing here is the peanut chutney with dosa. Dosa they get it when you order and it included in buffet.

I have tried all other food items in the menu and they are very taste and good. All are fresh and you will feel like homemade. They did good job. 👏👏👏

The food was delicious! Four of us ordered 4 different dishes, and all were fantastic! Portion was quite good. We ordered one Minarva special pesarattu, one madala dosa, one Karam uttapam with onion, and one Karam masala dosa. Masala tea and filtered coffee were great as well. For dessert, falooda was fantastic! We are sure going back there and going to recommend our friends too.

I don’t usually write reviews but the experience my friends and I had at this restaurant definitely warranted one.
The service: It is something that is such an important aspect of dining out which completes the overall experience and can even outweigh the taste of the food. You could tell that the restaurant really cared about providing genuine service which proudly represents the warmth and care of the South Indian culture ❤️🫶
The food: The food was prepared fresh with good quality ingredients. I read on their menu that they do not use any artificial flavouring or colouring in their food which is always a concern with other restaurants. I’m obsessed with the Punugulu. Their dosas were very crisp which is how we requested it. (You can asked them to prepare it soft) Their podi idli, although the podi is not how I’m used to eating, was good. (Podi preference could be biased since it’s different from how my South Indian bestie’s mom makes it. Which is what I’m used to) Their sambar does not have the typical restaurant taste but a more home cooked taste which is what I like anyways. (They also mentioned on their menu that their recipes have a homemade flavour, hence the homely taste) The food to chutney ratio is very generous. I don’t dip but drown my food with chutney and I still left with a ramekin of their peanut chutney that was left over which my brother eat as soon as I got home. Lol. And he is not a fan of South Indian food so you can tell that their food tastes amazing! The sugarcane juice and mango lassi were very refreshing.
The price: We felt like we ate so much but our bill was wayyy less than what we would spend at other places.
This is now my go-to spot for South Indian food cravings. One of our servers mentioned that they will soon be opening a location in the West and honestly, it’s high time the West has a restaurant that actually tastes good without all the unnecessary hype!
Ps: The steam rising from the dosas was a testament to their freshness; unfortunately, we devoured our food too quickly for more photos! 😋
Absolutley authentic south indian food! You will not be disappointed eating at this place. Really good portion size for the price. And very friendly service.

Just so that people don’t think it’s a fake review, I decided to give 4 stars out of five, although I loved everything about this restaurant. We called for Mirchi bajji, Dahi vada, punugulu, and poori bhaji. All of them were good. Since I live on the other side of GTA, visiting this place wouldn’t be that convenient, but would definitely come back if I’m in this vicinity.

Good going Minerva Tiffins!! Keep up the quality.

displayName.text: The Keg Steakhouse + Bar - Leslie Street

editorialSummary.text: Classic steak & seafood dishes are the mainstays at this stylish yet casual chain restaurant.

text.text: Good food. Prime rib and Billy miner pie is always amazing. We had lunch here on a weekday. Got seated right away. Our server was very attentive and checked in on us. Food came out fast. Only complaint is that it’s so dark inside and in the washrooms. The washroom also didn’t smell the best.

Food: 2.5 Stars
Service: 2 Stars
Ambience: 1.5 Stars
Value: 2 Stars
Overall: 2 Stars

I've been a regular of this particular Keg Steakhouse location for years, often choosing it for special occasions like birthdays and anniversaries. Regrettably, my recent visit to celebrate my birthday was a letdown, marking a notable decline from the high standards I had come to expect here.

To start, our server's attention was minimal, with scarce check-ins on our table. This lack of attentiveness was a stark contrast to the exemplary service I was accustomed to here. From the moment we were seated at our table we immediately noticed that the restaurant's ambiance has noticeably deteriorated. The once well-maintained setting now shows signs of neglect, with dirty carpets and ripped, uncomfortable seating. This decline in upkeep diminishes the overall dining experience and suggests a need for renovation.

Also once we received our water we knew something was off-putting. The water cups had an unpleasant odour, reminiscent of a dirty washcloth. Though it was promptly replaced upon request, the experience was disconcerting. Further, the food quality, unfortunately, did not live up to past experiences. The baked garlic shrimp, once served with buttery, fluffy brioche, is now paired with an airy Kaiser bread - a less appealing combination. Additionally, the onion soup was overly salty, lacking the rich flavour balance it previously had. Luckily, the  Calamari and the Pistachio Crusted Salmon paired with vegetables we ordered was satisfactory.

Despite the subpar service, we left a 25% tip. However, the server's indifferent response to this gesture further added to our disappointment.

In conclusion, while I have fond memories of dining here, this visit was underwhelming. For the price you are paying the service, ambience, and food quality here is not worth it. This location really has declined, and I hope this feedback serves as constructive criticism for improvement. A return to its former standards would be greatly welcomed by regular customers like myself.

kellychan360

I've always loved The Keg; I think it's the best value steakhouse out there. The service is great, and every visit makes you feel right at home.

This time, to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday, I tried their super cost-effective hidden menu:
First, when making a reservation, note that it's for a birthday or other anniversary celebration. The server will usually ask, "What's your occasion?" At that point, you can politely ask if they could bring a complimentary cake for the celebration.
When ordering, tell the server you want the 24oz Omega Prime Rib (not listed on the menu, $63 per serving), and that you want to share it between two people. For the side dish, I highly recommend choosing the Twice Baked Potato, which doesn't cost extra.
We also ordered a starter of fried calamari, $19.

Here’s my honest review of this meal:
🍞The pre-dinner bread was soft and fragrant, with a fluffy texture. Spreading on thick butter made it taste absolutely divine, making it hard to resist eating several pieces.
🦑Calamari: The freshly fried squid rings were crispy, although a bit small, but the flavor was quite good. The large plate also had red peppers and jalapeños mixed in, along with two dipping sauces, making for a rich and varied taste experience.
🥩Omega Prime Rib: The steak was enormous, a full 24oz and impressively thick. I ordered it medium rare, which was perfect for me. The steak was so thick it was almost like eating braised beef, with each bite being incredibly satisfying. While prime rib isn't as tender as sirloin or mignon, the parts with tendons were super tasty. Eating such large chunks of meat was truly satisfying!
🥔Twice Baked Potato: This, in my opinion, is the star dish of the restaurant. As always, it was fantastic!
🍰Billy Miner Pie: This was the complimentary birthday cake. The cake's main part is coffee ice cream, topped with almond slices, and the base is a chocolate cookie. Even though the cake was quite sweet, it was free, which made it even sweeter in our hearts, and we were especially happy!

Conclusion: So, the total before tax and tip was just $82, but it was enough for three people! We were so full we couldn't finish it all, and the leftovers made for another meal the next day!

I have been to many other The Keg,but this was my first time to eat at this restaurant. The quality control was very poor. I ordered a medium-rare steak, but it came out medium-rare, and the meat looked very stale. After eating a few pieces, I immediately felt gastrointestinal discomfort, especially the manager's attitude was very bad. I suggest everyone not to go.

I had the burger it was very good tasty I loved it I did ask for mushroom rice instead of fries but didn't happen had the onion rings was not what I had expected would not order again. I found a hair on my plate thank goodness was when I was done.

editorialSummary.text: Specializing in Cantonese dishes, this casual, modern outfit also serves some Pan-Asian items.

text.text: Craving comfort food? Congee Queen North York delivers! Their congee is the star - perfectly cooked with flavorful broths and generous toppings. But don't stop there! They have delicious Cantonese dishes and some Pan-Asian options too. The atmosphere is casual and modern, making it a great spot to unwind and enjoy a satisfying meal. Be warned, it can get busy, so a short wait might be in store. Still, Congee Queen is a local favorite for a reason - definitely worth a try!

The restaurant was bigger than I thought but the vibe, was exactly as I’d expected, buzzy. My brother had made a reservation so we didn’t have to join the queue.
The menu was packed with a gazillion choices, so it took a while for us to decide. In the end, these were what we selected:
1. Sliced Fish & Pig’s Liver Congee – Very smooth and creamy, the congee had large pieces of both proteins which were well cooked.
2. Bittergourd with Pork – The default is beef but we asked to switch to pork which we agreed was a great idea as the white meat was fresh and tasty. Only thing is the chefs are rather heavy-handed with the black bean sauce, so we had to order a couple of bowls of plain rice to balance out the saltiness.
3. Rice Noodles with Beef in Scrambled Egg Sauce – They use narrow rice noodles and the slices of beef were plentiful. What impressed me most was the “wok hei” which was intense, and that made this dish of carbs smothered in eggy gravy, really enjoyable.
4. Soya Sauce Chicken – It was done perfectly, so even the breast meat was tender. A must-order in my opinion.
5. Twin Roasted Meat Platter – We loved the roasted duck and “siew yoke” (roasts pork belly). These were executed on point with the former being deeply fragrant, flavourful and juicy, and the latter boasting a super crunchy skin.
6. Century Egg & Pulled Pork Congee – I liked this even more than the first congee as it had a bolder taste.

My only regret is that we don’t live near this location. Whenever we come into town, this is one of our pit stops. One HAS to be patient… one of its quirks is that the servers can be harried. So, remain friendly & be assertive! Best fresh dish? Pan fried spicy tofu with peppers.
Another one of the congee queen outlets. Good quality chinese food. BBQ prok and ducks are nice. Lobster noodles are delicious. HK style milktea and coffees are good too,

It’s been a few years since we came here last, but nothing has changed much aside from how you order. We came here for Chinese New Year and surprisingly the wait for a table for 8 wasn’t too long.

Currently, they have a QR Code and you order on your phone.

The food is good. As someone who has many food allergies, they are good with listing ingredients on the menu and they don’t add stuff not mentioned on the menu (like other Congee Queens)

We will definitely come back in the future.

editorialSummary.text: Trendy bistro serving up artisan breakfast & brunch, plus desserts, drinks & sidewalk seating.

text.text: Mother's Day at Eggstatic was pretty great. I went with my daughter and we got a table quickly. By the time we were finished, there was a lineup, though. My daughter was not happy with her original order of kids breakfast, so the server graciously switched it out for the waffle. My daughter LOVED the waffle and fresh berries. My eggs were perfectly cooked. The toast was delicious. My coffee was very good, strong but not bitter. Definitely would go again.

This location offers a wonderful fusion of classic brunch items mixed with a Middle Eastern flair.

The seating is limited. So pack your patience and expect a wait if you cannot grab a table.

The food comes out fast and furious. My steak and eggs 🥚 was fresh and unique. It is a different take on a classic steak and eggs dish and it was good 👍 especially with the gravy … yummy 🤤.

All the other dishes that my party ordered were well received and they all enjoyed the fresh ingredients and its savoury notes.

The service gets 5 stars ✨ all the way here too.

Happy eats everyone 😎

I don’t normally post reviews but wow… This place was incredible. First thing I noticed was the service, the server was so sweet and kind.
The food was amazing. I got the chicken sandwich and it was so delicious and flavorful- love that they are halal. The mango strawberry lemonade was tasty and refreshing- I want to go back and try the blackberry peach. We ended with the kunafa pancake, a dish I am still thinking about the next day. Warm, soft and crispy, the sweetness was balanced perfectly with the subtly salty cheese.
The only downside is that the restaurant is so small and unassuming, but they make up for it tenfold with their service and food.

Absolutely loved the pancakes. If you are visiting this restaurant, pancakes are a MUST. The strawberry cheese pancake was SOOOO TASTY!!! The other dishes we got were pleasant too, the beef sausage was ok and the fried chicken was a bit tough. Other than that, the food was excellent. Service was great, the restaurant was clean and the food came out in perfect time. Halal too!

What an amazing discovery!  Our friends recommended this place and we finally got an opportunity to go when we were in the neighborhood for work.

Everything tasted great!  The salmon bites and shredded steak and eggs were amazing. The pistachio pancake is to die for, looks super sweet but is barely so. Worth every bite.

Chrissy took great care of while we were there.

We ordered almond croissant, spinach & artichoke brioche, stuffed everything bagel croissant-i added salmon here, black coffee and masala chai. All items tasted good, except stuffed everything bagel-it was very salty. Very nice ambiance inside and outside patio also available. Overall a good experience.

One of the best bakeries I've ever been to. The almond croissant, cinnamon roll, brownie and sesame baguette were absolutely delicious. I added a peach tea and everything came out to less than $28 which i find is reasonable for the level of taste, quality and portion size. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Parking is a long walk to the back of the building but you can take a risk and park on the street illegally if you're in and out. Lots of outdoor seating as well as a few tables inside. This is now my go to bakery.

Excellent bakery and cafe overall. Expect big crowds on the weekend. Finding a table was a bit difficult. They have coffee, fresh breads, lots of pastries, croissants and sandwiches. The deli sandwich on sesame baguette was very good. Only gripe is that the baguette was a bit hard. Everything croissant with smoked salmon was mind blowingly good. Pecan butter tart was also very good and tasted fresh. A tad bit too sweet. Cappuccino with oat milk was also quite good. We also got their focaccia bread to go. It was very soft and flavorful. The prices are typical. Everything adds up quickly. We found ourselves spending $50 for two people. We'll be back to try their sausage rolls.

I love this place! It's like a bakery you would find up north; everything is fresh daily but they also have delicious take-home options. The cappuccino and cold brew are amazing! Some faves are the matcha and the fresh cinnamon rolls they have for $5 on the weekend!

Follow @bredgyeats for yummy food pictures!

Whether you're here for a savory breakfast or a comforting sweet treat, this bakery might overwhelm you with too many options, as each pastry and baked goods calls for your name to be taken home with you. Despite my sweet tooth, my favourite was the ham and swiss croissant. Delicately flaky that honestly needs a spotlight of its own, its light buttery taste complimenting the umami of the ham, nuttiness of the swiss, while the arugula completes the bite with a bitter freshness. I can only imagine what the other croissant sandwiches taste like, until I go back, of course.

displayName.text: 老九门火锅旗舰店laojiumen hotpot 9

editorialSummary.text: Fashionable restaurant specializing in traditional hot pots with meat, seafood & veggie options.

text.text: Came here for their $29.99 deal. Not bad at all. They had good food selection. Beef and most other ingredients were of good quality. Soup base was flavorful and came at no extra charge. The friend chicken wings were surprisingly good. Service was good enough. The restaurant could be a little more clean. A few things felt kind of sticky. I liked it and would recommend.

We loved this Sichan AYCE Hot Pot so much that we dined here twice in less than a week!  The interior is gorgeous with “traditional meets modern” oriental aesthetics!  Plenty of seating, including private rooms, and free parking .

The variety of soup bases is impressive, and we chose the two flavor broths each time.

We dined in for the Happy Hour special from Monday - Friday between 12pm-5pm for $25.99 per person (cash only, excludes weekends & holidays).
There is a promo now for a group of 4 for dinner ($33.99 per person + $2 on holidays), one dines free, (cash only, and both promos can’t be combined).

The service is amazing, and the quality of the meats and ingredients is fabulous!  We’re looking at returning for a third time!

If you love hotpot, this is a must-go spot. If you are not a big fan of hotpot, you should still go here because they have cooked items that are really delicious as well. A variety of skewers, chicken wings, fried chicken, fried shrimps, tea eggs, fried rice, crispy fried pork, sliced offals or pig ears in chili sauce are available for people who don't eat a lot of hotpot. For those that do love hotpot, there's a huge selection or meats and veggies for your delight and many different broths for you to choose from. They are currently running their summer promotion so it's only $29.99/p (+2 on weekends/holidays) so it's very reasonable for such a delicious offering. We had Ying Yang broth with half pork bone and half spicy beef tallow. The broths were so delicious and the spicy one is SUPER spicy so be very careful. They have a very large sauce station in case you still need to dip and also dessert options like fruits, mango sago, deep fried bun with condensed milk and fried sesame balls.

A must visit for hotpot fanatics. Just the atmosphere alone is superb. During our visit we are the first customer and we have the whole place to explore. They have dipping sauce and appetizer section. The soup broth is of course good. The service is fast and the place is really well maintained. But the only thing not allowed is to take out the left overs that you had. But that's fine as we really enjoyed eating here.

Came here with my family during the summer special of Laojiumen Hotpot. The price is good with soft drinks included. Their selection of food items is extensive, fresh and in good quality while their service was excellent. I ordered two non-spicy broth. The coconut broth tasted sweet with the taste of ccoonut; the tomato broth was likewise satisfying. Cooking lamb, pork, different cuts of beef and seafood in either broth made them very tasty. Like in other hotpot restaurants, they offered cooked food in their menu. I like their deep fried chicken and pork and chicken wings, braised tofu, and different kinds of offal.

editorialSummary.text: Understated restaurant specializing in kebab wraps & dishes with rice, plus spring rolls.

text.text: Aleppo Kebab is one of the best kebab restaurants in the city. We’ve ordered it a number of times (both dine in and delivery) and every time it has been delicious and freshly made.  The spicy bread is stupidly good. The platters are such a bargain considering how much meat and the sides you get. If you haven’t tried it yet, go go go!

On a recent visit with my girlfriend, I ordered the beef kabob plate, forgetting her dietary restrictions. But the staff surprised us with a free chicken plate, while letting us keep the beef platter as well. The chicken platter was a feast for the senses, with juicy kabobs and delicious sides. What truly made our experience memorable was the kindness of the staff. Their thoughtful gesture turned a simple meal into a heartwarming moment. Not only does this restaurant serve fantastic food but also exemplifies exceptional hospitality. Whether you're a food enthusiast or simply seeking a warm welcome, this place is a must-visit, it’s also always packed due to how popular it is! We'll definitely be back for more of their delicious dishes and wonderful service. Overall rating is 4.8/5.

We were looking 👀 for a new 🆕 food 🍲 🍱 🥘 place for dinner 🍲 🍽️ 🥘🍴where we can try a good 👍 healthy barbecue 🍗 food. So, we decided to visit Aleppo Kebab located in Scarborough, ON.

If you’re looking 👀 for a phenomenal food 🍲 🍱 🥘 / dining experience, look no further than Aleppo Kebab. Their menu is a culinary masterpiece, offering an incredible selection of dishes that cater to diverse tastes and preferences. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the staff 👨‍🍳👩‍🍳🧑‍🍳 is friendly and attentive, making every visit a true pleasure.

Aleppo Kebab is a lovely 😊 place. Away from the hustle and bustle of the city 🏙️ in spite of being in the city 🌃. There’s an ample parking 🅿️ space around the building.
The place has the small indoor seating arrangements and the seating arrangement is comfortable. The staff is really nice and friendly. The food 🍱 🍲 🥘 menu is great 👍 and there are many choices to choose from and they also offer quite a lot of small bites options to choose from.Pricing 💲 is decent, good 👍 value for money 💰 💵 and the place is more suitable for a group of people.

We ordered catering for our office which was a big hit! There was a large variety of options, particularly dips, and everything was delicious. The kebabs were flavourful and juicy and all the sides were great accompaniments. Chef Zak was able to accommodate our large order in just a few days' notice. He was also very responsive and followed up afterwards to make sure everything went well. I would highly recommend Aleppo Kebab!

Had heard about this place a lot, paid them a visit today, it was around 5pm, couldn't find a parking spot at first, went around the other street, came back, and I was lucky enough to find a spot right in front.

It was packed inside, had to wait to be seated, it's a very small space, with very little dine-in room, so take-out is preferred.

Our order arrived in 30 mins. It was their mix kebab that comes with hummus, sauce and pickels, and also tried cheese rolls. And wow 👌🏼,, I was a happy soul , the food looked good, and tasted amazingly delicious, everything was perfectly cooked and spiced to my liking, 🙏 🤗

And it's all Halal.. highly recommended!!

After reading so many good reviews, we had to give this place a try. The food was decent here however, and the com tom and pho weren’t blow-your-mind-out good (which we expected reading the reviews). The one thing that stood out was the banh xeo, which was super thin and crispy.

Really great pho and Vietnamese food. The portions are big and really good value. The quality is amazing and the flavors authentic. Super comforting environment and kind staff. They offer a discount if you pay in cash. Really popular for both dine in and takeout, highly recommended place!

Good food that comes out quickly. Within minutes of placing our order the food came out hot and ready. The broth was great, nothing bad to say. Service was nice and quick. The menu is easy to read and prices are very fair. I order P9 XL and it really was XL. There’s way more than it seems

Ok first time here, one of my co-workers recommended this place. Checked reviews and was impressed so I've been wanting to try this place for a little while now. Those who read my reviews will know that I strive for accuracy and authenticity in my reviews. This one has a few ups and downs. So first thing first, i went woth the rare beef pho. Ive been craving pho since last night so i was pumped to have skme finally. Broth was really good! Not overly salty but very beef flavourful! Busy place, everyone seed to be enjoying their food. So here's where it gets a bit tricky. So while eating, meaning that at first it was not obvious, I found a piece of plastic embedded in my noodles! I had already eaten a few bites and even stirred everything up but didn't notice the plastic until maybe about a quarter way through the meal. So after I told them I was about to leave but they insisted on making me a new bowl and would comp the meal. Usually I don't accept any kind of make ups because I want to remain unbiased in my reviews but this time I accepted as I was stsrving and had to go back to work soon. Second jowl qas ok, broth was still outstanding but the portion seemed smaller than the first, understandable since it was going to be comp anyways. Overall good on the restaurant for giving me a new bowl and for comping it. Bad on them for ha ING the plastic in the first place. Tbh, I'm writing this review after getting back to the office and my stomach isn't feeling the best right now. Not sure if it's related to the pho I just had...in any event not sure if I can recommend this place because of the plastic but you can be your own judge here. Doesn't decent customer service outweigh bad Q amd A? Only you can decide that for yourself. I'm really on the fence if I would return though...

First time here to try out this highly rated pho and banh mi joint. We arrived around 11:30am and it was packed. We had a large group so we waited about 30 min. Not too bad as the line moved fairly quickly. They were known for their banh mi. A note here that you have to order the sandwiches separately at the front where they make them, not from the menu. What I love about the banh mi is the bread. Crunchy on the outside but soft inside, you know the banh mi is on point when their bread is fresh. We also ordered their house pho and the Vietnamese spicy broth pho. The broth of the beef pho is flavorful and they are very generous on the beef slices, for both phos. While the spicy broth was decent but lacking the heat. We also ordered the pancake. It's very different,the egg pancake is crunchy, not soft pancake, with pork shrimp and beansprouts inside. Love the texture actually. We didn't know how to eat this but we think after the fact that you are supposed to do lettuce wraps with the pickled veggies and the pancake. Need to return and try again. Overall I would return to try other items on the menu.

Karahi Boys offers a delightful culinary experience with rich, authentic flavors. The aromatic spices and tender meat in their karahi are a must-try. Friendly service and cozy ambiance make it a top choice in Scarborough.

What can I say, amazing experience, great customer service and food was amazing. Most surprisingly, owner came to each and every single table to make sure all his customer are happy and enjoying their food. And We don't forget the staff, super friendly and excellent work ethic. Would be going back soon. Thank you everyone at Karahi Boys for this amazing experience. Served by Manan/subekshya.

Karahi Boys is a true gem! The ambiance is cozy and elegant, perfect for any occasion. The food is outstanding – all the Kadais and barbecues are the highlights, bursting with flavor. We also tried their Lahori Chhole and Chicken Haleem which were great.
The service is top-notch, and dessert selection is impressive. We were served by Manan, who was very welcoming and made great recommendations. He really uplifted our dining experience.
Highly recommend for an unforgettable dining when you are craving for desi cuisine!

Celebrating our Mother’s 83rd Birthday. What a wonderful way to do so. The restaurant atmosphere is welcoming and upscale. The food was exceptional! Easily the best Pakistani food we have had across Toronto. The service and food recommendations were on point and the customer care was excellent.

Karahi Boys in Toronto serves the best Karahi dish in the entire GTA. The genuine, rustic taste mirrors that of traditional karahi restaurants from the subcontinent, making every bite a nostalgic delight. The flavors are authentic and rich, capturing the essence of the dish perfectly. A must-visit for anyone craving an exceptional karahi experience.
